description:
Displays an element positioned against the popover anchor.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

Renders a `<button>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.

nativeButton.description:
Whether the component renders a native `<button>` element when replacing it
via the `render` prop.
Set to `false` if the rendered element is not a button (e.g. `<div>`).
nativeButton.name: nativeButton

A paragraph with additional information about the popover. Renders a `

` element. Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

description:
A container for the popover contents.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

initialFocus.description:
Determines the element to focus when the popover is opened.

- `false`: Do not move focus.
- `true`: Move focus based on the default behavior (first tabbable element or popup).
- `RefObject`: Move focus to the ref element.
- `function`: Called with the interaction type (`mouse`, `touch`, `pen`, or `keyboard`).
  Return an element to focus, `true` to use the default behavior, or `false`/`undefined` to do nothing.
initialFocus.name: initialFocus

type.name: boolean | RefObject<HTMLElement> | ((openType: InteractionType) => boolean | void | HTMLElement)

finalFocus.description:
Determines the element to focus when the popover is closed.

- `false`: Do not move focus.
- `true`: Move focus based on the default behavior (trigger or previously focused element).
- `RefObject`: Move focus to the ref element.
- `function`: Called with the interaction type (`mouse`, `touch`, `pen`, or `keyboard`).
  Return an element to focus, `true` to use the default behavior, or `false`/`undefined` to do nothing.
finalFocus.name: finalFocus

type.name: boolean | RefObject<HTMLElement> | ((closeType: InteractionType) => boolean | void | HTMLElement)

description:
A portal element that moves the popup to a different part of the DOM.
By default, the portal element is appended to `<body>`.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

keepMounted.description: Whether to keep the portal mounted in the DOM while the popup is hidden.
keepMounted.name: keepMounted

container.description: A parent element to render the portal element into.
container.name: container

description:
Positions the popover against the trigger.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

anchor.description:
An element to position the popup against.
By default, the popup will be positioned against the trigger.
anchor.name: anchor

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

sticky.description:
Whether to maintain the popup in the viewport after
the anchor element was scrolled out of view.
sticky.name: sticky

side.description:
Which side of the anchor element to align the popup against.
May automatically change to avoid collisions.
side.name: side

align.description: How to align the popup relative to the specified side.
align.name: align

positionMethod.description: Determines which CSS `position` property to use.
positionMethod.name: positionMethod

sideOffset.description:
Distance between the anchor and the popup in pixels.
Also accepts a function that returns the distance to read the dimensions of the anchor
and positioner elements, along with its side and alignment.

The function takes a `data` object parameter with the following properties:
- `data.anchor`: the dimensions of the anchor element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.positioner`: the dimensions of the positioner element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.side`: which side of the anchor element the positioner is aligned against.
- `data.align`: how the positioner is aligned relative to the specified side.
@example ```jsx
<Positioner
  sideOffset={({ side, align, anchor, positioner }) => {
    return side === 'top' || side === 'bottom'
      ? anchor.height
      : anchor.width;
  }}
/>
```
sideOffset.name: sideOffset

alignOffset.description:
Additional offset along the alignment axis in pixels.
Also accepts a function that returns the offset to read the dimensions of the anchor
and positioner elements, along with its side and alignment.

The function takes a `data` object parameter with the following properties:
- `data.anchor`: the dimensions of the anchor element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.positioner`: the dimensions of the positioner element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.side`: which side of the anchor element the positioner is aligned against.
- `data.align`: how the positioner is aligned relative to the specified side.
@example ```jsx
<Positioner
  alignOffset={({ side, align, anchor, positioner }) => {
    return side === 'top' || side === 'bottom'
      ? anchor.width
      : anchor.height;
  }}
/>
```
alignOffset.name: alignOffset

collisionBoundary.description: An element or a rectangle that delimits the area that the popup is confined to.
collisionBoundary.name: collisionBoundary

collisionPadding.description: Additional space to maintain from the edge of the collision boundary.
collisionPadding.name: collisionPadding

arrowPadding.description:
Minimum distance to maintain between the arrow and the edges of the popup.

Use it to prevent the arrow element from hanging out of the rounded corners of a popup.
arrowPadding.name: arrowPadding

disableAnchorTracking.description: Whether to disable the popup from tracking any layout shift of its positioning anchor.
disableAnchorTracking.name: disableAnchorTracking

collisionAvoidance.name: collisionAvoidance

description:
Groups all parts of the popover.
Doesn’t render its own HTML element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

defaultOpen.description:
Whether the popover is initially open.

To render a controlled popover, use the `open` prop instead.
defaultOpen.name: defaultOpen

open.description: Whether the popover is currently open.
open.name: open

onOpenChange.description: Event handler called when the popover is opened or closed.
onOpenChange.name: onOpenChange

onOpenChangeComplete.description: Event handler called after any animations complete when the popover is opened or closed.
onOpenChangeComplete.name: onOpenChangeComplete

actionsRef.description:
A ref to imperative actions.
- `unmount`: When specified, the popover will not be unmounted when closed.
Instead, the `unmount` function must be called to unmount the popover manually.
Useful when the popover's animation is controlled by an external library.
- `close`: Closes the dialog imperatively when called.
actionsRef.name: actionsRef

modal.description:
Determines if the popover enters a modal state when open.
- `true`: user interaction is limited to the popover: document page scroll is locked, and pointer interactions on outside elements are disabled.
- `false`: user interaction with the rest of the document is allowed.
- `'trap-focus'`: focus is trapped inside the popover, but document page scroll is not locked and pointer interactions outside of it remain enabled.
modal.name: modal

triggerId.description:
ID of the trigger that the popover is associated with.
This is useful in conjunction with the `open` prop to create a controlled popover.
There's no need to specify this prop when the popover is uncontrolled (i.e. when the `open` prop is not set).
triggerId.name: triggerId

defaultTriggerId.description:
ID of the trigger that the popover is associated with.
This is useful in conjunction with the `defaultOpen` prop to create an initially open popover.
defaultTriggerId.name: defaultTriggerId

handle.description:
A handle to associate the popover with a trigger.
If specified, allows external triggers to control the popover's open state.
handle.name: handle

children.description:
The content of the popover.
This can be a regular React node or a render function that receives the `payload` of the active trigger.
children.name: children

description:
A heading that labels the popover.
Renders an `<h2>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

description:
A button that opens the popover.
Renders a `<button>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

nativeButton.description:
Whether the component renders a native `<button>` element when replacing it
via the `render` prop.
Set to `false` if the rendered element is not a button (e.g. `<div>`).
nativeButton.name: nativeButton

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

handle.description: A handle to associate the trigger with a popover.
handle.name: handle

payload.description: A payload to pass to the popover when it is opened.
payload.name: payload

openOnHover.description: Whether the popover should also open when the trigger is hovered.
openOnHover.name: openOnHover

delay.description:
How long to wait before the popover may be opened on hover. Specified in milliseconds.

Requires the `openOnHover` prop.
delay.name: delay

closeDelay.description:
How long to wait before closing the popover that was opened on hover.
Specified in milliseconds.

Requires the `openOnHover` prop.
closeDelay.name: closeDelay

description:
A viewport for displaying content transitions.
This component is only required if one popup can be opened by multiple triggers, its content change based on the trigger
and switching between them is animated.
Renders a `<div>` element.

Documentation: [Base UI Popover](https://base-ui.com/react/components/popover)

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

children.description: The content to render inside the transition container.
children.name: children

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render
